title: Ticket #4455: Let chirp set/read private job ad attributes
description:
A parallel universe job might be using chirp to transfer private information between nodes. For example, node 0 might set up a server for other nodes to connect to, and need to transmit a dynamically created security key. While you could bake a hard coded key in, a dynamic key ensures that someone who gains read access to the executable can't connect to the running server.

To aid in this, it would be nice for chirp to be able to read and set private attributes in the job ad. Some additional security would be warranted, perhaps similar to https://htcondor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu/index.cgi/tktview?tn=3353
creator: adesmet
